page.title: 07The Sewage Farm at Holmes.
page.content: At Holmes there is a Sewage works where the dirty and used water for Holmes, Merebrow and Tarleton is treated. it can deal with 1,100,000 gallons of sewage at once. It is a very smelly place but friendly people look after it. The dirty water goes through a lot of pumps; different machines and filter beds which clean it. In it there are lots of little animals called Bacteria which live on the sewage and they help to clean the water. The sludge at the bottom of the tanks is pumped into lorries and put on the farmers fields. You can sometimes smell the sludge on the fields. the sewage farm was opend in 1967 before then septic tanks where used. It is very intresting and exciting place to visit.
